pageContext.claim: “Not only did we win the election, we had an Electoral College landslide.”
pageContext.analysis: Hillary Clinton won the popular vote, and Trump's victory was hardly an electoral college landslide. According to a tally by John Pitney of Claremont McKenna College, every Republican president since Rutherford B. Hayes in 1876 won a larger share of the electoral college votes than Trump, with the exception of George W. Bush (twice) and Nixon in 1968.
